New Records: Jason Holder took four wickets in four balls, becoming the fourth man to achieve this feat in a T20 international.
Key Match Events: West Indies won the final T20 against England by 17 runs to complete a 3-2 series victory.
Jason Holder took a double hat-trick, ending England's hopes in an instant.
Akeal Hosein took 4-24, playing a crucial role in West Indies' victory.
Kieron Pollard and Rovman Powell shared a destructive partnership, hitting 66 off the last 24 balls.
James Vince scored 55, keeping England in touch until the final overs.
England needed 20 runs off the last over, but Jason Holder's four wickets in four balls sealed the win for West Indies.
Pre-Game Insights: Kieron Pollard chose to bat, anticipating that chasing would be difficult under lights.
Post-Match Reflections: Defeat exposed areas needing attention for England, especially their death bowling, just nine months out from the T20 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on the same pitch where Rovman Powell had run riot earlier in the series.
West Indies struggled against spin, losing 4-54 against slow bowling.
West Indies were brutal against pace, with just five wickets going to seamers at a significant cost of 503 runs in total.
